ul.li1: 1My child, if you have pledged to your neighbor,
ul.li2: if you have bound yourselfLiterally “palms of your hands” to the stranger,
ul.li1: 2if you are snared by the sayings of your mouth,
ul.li2: if you are caught by the sayings of your mouth,
ul.li1: 3do this, then, my child, and save yourself,
ul.li2: for you have come into the palm of your neighbor’s hand:Literally “the palm of the hand of your neighbor”
Go, humble yourself, plead with your neighbor.
ul.li1: 4Do not give sleep to your eyes,
ul.li2: or slumber to your eyelids.
ul.li1: 5Save yourself like a gazelle from a hand,
ul.li2: or like a bird from the hand of a fowler.

ul.li1: 6Go to the ant, lazy!
ul.li2: Consider its ways and be wise.
ul.li1: 7It has no chief,
ul.li2: officer, or ruler.
ul.li1: 8In the summer, it prepares its food;
ul.li2: in the harvest, it gathers its sustenance.
ul.li1: 9How long will you lie down, lazy?
ul.li2: When will you rise up from your sleep?
ul.li1: 10A little sleep, a little slumber,
ul.li2: a little folding of the hands for rest—
ul.li1: 11like a robberLiterally “one who walks,” that is, a vagabond shall your poverty come,
ul.li2: and what you lack like an armed man.

ul.li1: 12A worthless man, an evil man,
ul.li2: goes around with deceitful speech.Literally “crookedness of mouth”
ul.li1: 13Winking in his eye, shuffling in his foot,
ul.li2: pointing in his fingers,
ul.li1: 14perversion in his heart, he devises evil;
ul.li2: at all times he will send out discord.Or “quarrels”
ul.li1: 15Upon such a man,Literally “thus” suddenly shall his calamity come;
ul.li2: in a moment he will be damaged and there is no healing.Or “repair”

ul.li1: 16There are six things Yahweh hates,
ul.li2: and seven things are abominations of his soul:Or “inner self”
ul.li1: 17haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
ul.li2: and hands that shed innocent blood,
ul.li1: 18a devising heart, plans of deception,
ul.li2: feet that hurry to run to evil,Hebrew “the evil”
ul.li1: 19a false witness who breathes lies
ul.li2: and sends out discordOr “quarrels” between brothers.

ul.li1: 20My child, keep the commandment of your father,
ul.li2: and do not disregard the instruction of your mother.
ul.li1: 21Bind them on your heart continually;
ul.li2: tie them upon your neck.
ul.li1: 22When you walk,Literally “In your walking” sheThat is, “commandment” and “instruction” will lead you,
ul.li2: When you lie down,Literally “In your lying down” she will watch over you,
and when you awake, she will converse with you.
ul.li1: 23For like a lamp is a commandment, and instruction is light,
ul.li2: and the way of lifeHebrew “lives” is the reproof of discipline,
ul.li1: 24in order to preserve you from an evil woman,Or “wife”
ul.li2: from the smoothness of the tongue of an adulteress.Literally “a foreign woman”
ul.li1: 25Do not desire her beauty in your heart;
ul.li2: may she not capture you with her eyelashes.
ul.li1: 26For the price of a woman, a prostitute,Or “whore” is the price of a loaf of bread,
ul.li2: but the woman belonging to a manLiterally “the woman of a man” hunts precious life.

chapter.pericope: Warning Against Relations with a Married Woman

ul.li1: 27Can a man carry fire in his lap,
ul.li2: and his clothes not burn?
ul.li1: 28If a man walks upon the hot coals,
ul.li2: will his feet not be burned?
ul.li1: 29Thus, he who goes to the wife of his neighbor,
ul.li2: any who touches her shall not go unpunished.
ul.li1: 30People do not despise a thief when he steals
ul.li2: to fill himselfOr “soul,” or “inner self” when he is hungry.
ul.li1: 31But if he is found, he will pay sevenfold,
ul.li2: every possession of his house he shall give.
ul.li1: 32He who commits adultery with a woman lacks sense,Literally “heart”
ul.li2: he destroys himselfOr “his soul,” or “his life” who does it.
ul.li1: 33A wound and dishonor he will find,
ul.li2: and his disgrace will not be wiped out.
ul.li1: 34For jealousy is the fury of a husband,
ul.li2: and he will not show restraint on the day of revenge.
ul.li1: 35He will not accept any compensation,Literally “the face of any compensation”
ul.li2: and he will not be willing, though the bribe is large.
